subject: Management
title: Surfacing Hidden Problems
description: A fast breakdown of Surfacing Hidden Problems for builders.

hook.text: A team had a blow-up about a missed deadline. It revealed that three processes were broken.

buildup.text: Conflict often exposes systemic problems that were invisible when everyone stayed polite.

discovery.text: The disagreement isn't the disease. It's the symptom that points to the real issue.

twist.text: Suppressing conflict hides the symptoms. The disease keeps growing until it's too late.

climax.text: When conflict erupts, ask: what broken system allowed this to happen? Fix the system.

punchline.text: Conflict is a diagnostic tool. Use it to find what's broken.

quiz.question: How does conflict serve as a diagnostic tool?
options: It exposes hidden systemic problems that politeness conceals
It distracts from the real issues that need attention
Only external conflicts reveal internal organizational problems
